race.name: Nova Eroica
race.tagline: Tuscan strade bianche‚Äî135km of iconic white roads, 2,800m elevation, medieval town charm, Italian gravel paradise.

terrain.primary: Tuscan strade bianche‚Äîrolling white gravel roads
terrain.surface: 70% gravel (strade bianche), 30% paved roads. Tuscan strade bianche‚Äîrolling hills, white gravel roads. 2,800 m over 135 km. Medieval town start/finish. Technical rating: 3/5.

biased_opinion.summary: Nova Eroica is Tuscan strade bianche‚Äî135 km, 2,800 m elevation. Founded ~2015. 70% gravel (strade bianche), 30% paved. Rolling Tuscan hills, iconic white roads. 1,000-1,500 riders. Buonconvento medieval town. October autumn conditions (12-22¬∞C). Affordable entry (‚Ç¨80-‚Ç¨120 / $85-$130). If you want Italian gravel with Tuscan scenery and strade bianche, this is it. If you want local/domestic race, skip it. International destination race.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: Nova Eroica is Tuscan strade bianche paradise. 135 km, 2,800 m, iconic white roads. If you want Italian gravel with stunning Tuscan scenery and affordable entry, this is it. If you want local/domestic, skip it. International travel required but Tuscany makes it worth it. Post-race food/wine is legendary.

logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Florence (FLR). Rental car needed (80 km, 1.5-hour drive to Buonconvento). Medieval town lodging‚Äîbook early. Day-before packet pickup. Race October. Post-race Tuscan food/wine.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party with Tuscan food/wine celebration.

course_description.character: 135 km, 2,800 m. 70% gravel (strade bianche), 30% paved. Tuscan rolling hills. Technical rating: 3/5.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Tuscan Rolling Hills
suffering_zones.description: Rolling Tuscan hills. 2,800 m cumulative elevation. Strade bianche (white roads).
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Pace conservatively. Moderate gears. Cumulative elevation adds up. 135 km long.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Strade Bianche (White Roads)
suffering_zones.description: Iconic Tuscan white gravel roads. Smooth but dusty. 32-38mm tires recommended.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: 32-38mm tubeless. Steady pace. Dusty but beautiful. Enjoy scenery.

course_description.signature_challenge: 135 km + 2,800 m cumulative elevation. Tuscan strade bianche rolling hills.

history.origin_story: Nova Eroica founded ~2015. Tuscan strade bianche gravel. 135 km, 1,000-1,500 riders. Buonconvento medieval town. Italian gravel scene.
history.reputation: Italian gravel scene. Tuscan strade bianche. Well-organized. Medieval town. International destination.

logistics.explanation: JOM called it 'one of my best days on a bicycle' after completing the 95km route, suggesting the organization delivers despite small-town Italian infrastructure. The festival atmosphere in Buonconvento works well for the day-before walkabout and post-race scene.

length.explanation: 84 miles with timed segments on Monte Sante Marie and San Martino creates the perfect balance‚Äîlong enough for proper suffering, structured enough to race when you want. JOM's group rode tempo between timed sectors, 'enjoying the food stops and scenery.' Longer than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

technicality.explanation: The course uses famous Strade Bianche sectors including Monte Sante Marie, but 2025 photos show 'steep grade, loose conditions, everyone walking' on descents. Classic Tuscan gravel that challenges through distance and climbing, not technical handling skills. Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds.

elevation.explanation: 9,186 feet over 84 miles through the same sectors that challenge WorldTour pros during Strade Bianche. Monte Sante Marie and San Martino provide the signature climbs, with enough elevation to separate the field without destroying the experience. More climbing than SBT GRVL at the same score.

climate.explanation: Weather runs the gamut‚Äî2021 saw 'cooler temperatures and a very light drizzle' instead of typical July heat, while 2025 had 'storms nearby' that 'blew through quickly.' Italian spring delivers 'filtered sun and misted gravel' when it cooperates. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: Rolling Tuscan hills sit comfortably at sea level elevations. The challenge comes from cumulative climbing and distance, not oxygen deprivation. Altitude simply isn't a factor in the Val d'Orcia. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds ‚Äî no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Racing the same sectors as Fabian Cancellara through 'abundant vineyards and steep sterrate' delivers adventure wrapped in cycling history. The course reaches places cars can't, through landscapes that have looked the same for centuries.

prestige.explanation: Using the actual Strade Bianche sectors gives this race cycling pedigree that matters. JOM managed 'the initial front group of 20 or so' and finished 'with the top cyclists,' suggesting the field takes it seriously despite the festival atmosphere.

race_quality.explanation: Perfect execution of the Eroica formula‚Äî84 miles through Tuscan countryside without the tourist trap bullshit. The organization knows what they're doing because they've been doing it right elsewhere. When the course delivers 9,186 feet of climbing through actual working farmland, not Instagram backdrop nonsense, that's race quality.

experience.explanation: The combination of 'gourmet food, wine, and the culture of Italy, provides a cycling experience that is like no other.' Aid stations overflow with Italian specialties while you're grinding through the same hills that define professional cycling.

community.explanation: 'There is a big party at the finish line, with tasty food and a festive environment' where riders share experiences. The festival atmosphere extends through Buonconvento, creating what organizers call 'Race. Ride. Relax.'

field_depth.explanation: JOM found himself racing with 'the initial front group of 20 or so' and finishing 'with the top cyclists' on the long route. The field attracts riders serious enough to push the pace on timed sectors while respecting the festival spirit. Deeper field than most ‚Äî comparable to Badlands.

value.explanation: Access to iconic Strade Bianche sectors combined with Italian aid stations featuring wine and gourmet food creates exceptional value. The 'wonderful and inclusive day out on the bike' delivers cycling history, culture, and community in one package.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs ‚Ç¨80-‚Ç¨120. Tuscany tourist pricing affects everything from hotels to meals, and getting to Buonconvento requires Italian travel logistics. Riders showed up on everything from 'Sweet drop bar Klein MTB conversions' to high-end steel, suggesting varied budget approaches work. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

final_verdict.one_liner: Tuscany's gravel answer to L'Eroica that trades vintage wool for modern suffering on the same unforgiving strade bianche.
final_verdict.should_you_race: You need legitimate climbing legs for 9,186 feet of Tuscan punishment and the bike handling skills to descend white gravel roads that turn sketchy fast. This isn't a beginner's intro to European gravel‚Äîit's proper suffering in postcard scenery. Show up undertrained and those rolling hills will expose every fitness gap you've been ignoring.
final_verdict.alternatives: L'Eroica gives you the same Tuscan strade bianche with vintage bike requirements and more prestige, while Strade Bianche Eroica delivers similar terrain with better organization and clearer logistics. Both spare you the mystery of what exactly you're signing up for.

unsplash_photos.description: a bunch of rocks that are laying on the ground
A bird is standing in the middle of the dirt

primary.name: IRC Boken Double Cross
primary.why: Underrated mixed-terrain tire. Fast center with confident shoulder grip.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: NOVA Eroica Switzerland 2023
videos.description:
Immerse yourself in the enchanting beauty of Switzerland's stunning countryside as you follow our intrepid cyclists on their epic Eroica adventure. From majestic mountains to rolling hills and charming villages, every frame captures the essence of a true cycling paradise. Feel the wind on your face and the rhythm of your heartbeat as you witness the sheer freedom that cycling brings.

The NOVA Eroica Switzerland video is not just about the destination; it's a celebration of the journey itself. Witness the perseverance, determination, and camaraderie of these modern-day adventurers as they conquer challenging terrains and overcome personal limits. Be inspired by their stories of triumph and witness the transformative power of cycling on their lives.

videos.title: NOVA EROICA BUONCONVENTO 2025
videos.description:
Un‚Äôavventura epica tra le colline toscane üö¥‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüåø
In questo video vi portiamo con noi in un‚Äôindimenticabile esperienza gravel tra i paesaggi iconici della Toscana, partecipando alla leggendaria NOVA Eroica Buonconvento.

Un percorso capace di regalare panorami spettacolari e sensazioni autentiche, immersi nel fascino senza tempo delle strade bianche toscane.

Siamo partiti da principianti, scegliendo il tracciato corto, ma l‚Äôemozione √® stata enorme: chilometri di sterrato, vigneti che si perdono all‚Äôorizzonte e un‚Äôatmosfera unica, difficile da trovare altrove.

Lungo il percorso abbiamo incontrato persone straordinarie, condividendo sorrisi, racconti e momenti che rendono questo evento davvero speciale.

E naturalmente non √® mancato il gusto: piatti tipici, brindisi con un buon calice di Prosecco e quella convivialit√† che rende la NOVA Eroica un‚Äôesperienza da ricordare.

videos.title: Gravel Bike Check: What people are riding at Nova Eroica, Italy
videos.description:
2025 Nova Eroica: Buonconvento, Tuscany, Italy, June 22, 2025

"NOVA Eroica is an All Road cycling event in pure Eroica style. Open to all those who are looking for a unique and epic experience in the saddle of their modern racing, gravel or cyclo-cross bikes. NOVA Eroica celebrates the beauty of the white roads, the thrill of a challenge and the fun of cycling in the company of friends." - https://eroica.cc

In this video, JOM of the Gravel Cyclist captures bikes of interest before and during Nova Eroica.

Reminder:
ALWAYS BE A STEWARD FOR GRAVEL CYCLING: Respect the roads, respect the locals, respect the land, respect your fellow cyclists.

videos.curation_reason: Recent 2025 bike check video from respected gravel cycling channel providing insight into equipment choices for this specific event.

quotes.text: Good day, trends setters. Presenting to you today a quick video, the bikes of Nova Eroica, an event I attended recently in the beautiful Tuscan town of Buonconvento, Italy.
